tasks.task: Growing medicinal plants in a backyard garden
subtasks: Identify types of medicinal plants suitable for backyard cultivation
Understand different parts of plants used for medicine (seeds, flowers, leaves, roots, bark, fruit)
Learn about using plants for both acute and chronic conditions
Recognize the holistic approach of plant medicine in supporting organ function and reducing stress
Acknowledge that plant medicine benefits people of all ages
Realize that a small space is sufficient for growing medicinal plants
Understand the longevity of properly stored plant remedies
Learn to view existing yard weeds as potential medicinal sources
Ensure growing the correct variety/species of plants (e.g., calendula vs. regular marigold)
Know the optimal times to harvest plant parts (leaves, flowers, roots)
Understand preparation methods for immediate use (fresh) and long-term storage (drying, oils, tinctures)
Learn techniques for drying herbs (hanging bundles, small spaces)
Understand the benefits of tinctures (potency, flavor concealment, long shelf life)
Plan to use harvested plants in teas, poultices, compresses, soups, oils, balms, etc.
